title: 820-3437 no sound
message:
Everything else appears to work. After reading another thread, found this also has 0V at HDA_RST_L with IO board and cable connected. I've been unable to identify why. REsistors R131X all look good. Tried multiple I/O in boards and cables to no avail. It looks like most of the lines from j9500 go directly to the PCH. I've been bitten by the PCH snake a few times lately. 

Checked connections at bottom of J9500 and that they are pinging at cable connection end. I have PP1V5_S0SW_Audio at J9500 also.

title: 820-3437 no sound
message: Audio codec does not even recognized?

title: 820-3437 no sound
message: Correct. No options listed in audio settings. Pushing volume buttons shows speaker with not allowed/available? symbol.

title: 820-3437 no sound
message:
Audio codec is placed in LIO board.
So try known good LIO board and flex.

title: 820-3437 no sound
message: I already tried known good boards/flexes?

title: 820-3437 no sound
message: So does PCH detect with HDA_SDIN0 before giving 1.5V on HDA_RST_L? OR any guess what voltages signals must be going in to produce that output?

title: 820-3437 no sound
message: No communication is possible between PCH and audio codec, until reset signal goes high (disabled).

title: 820-3437 no sound
message:
Somehow I have 1.4V at HDA_RST_L now is over 1V enough?
Still no options show in sound devices

title: 820-3437 no sound
message:
Should be good now.
Possibly bad contacts in the LIO connector of MLB.
